intro: Pimpinella tripartita, commonly known as the three-parted cow-wheat, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a taproot system and produces small, dry fruits called schizocarps. Pimpinella tripartita is often found in temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia.
